newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech bank IPB raises base lending rate.
newsitem.headline: Czech bank IPB raises base lending rate.

text.p: Czech bank IPB a.s., the country's third largest bank, on Tuesday said it was raising its base lending rate by 120 basis points to 27.5 percent.
IPB said in a statement that the change would take effect June 12.

The IPB statement added that the bank was also raising its rates for term deposits of two weeks to 26 percent from 25 percent, for three-week term deposits to 23 percent from 22 percent, and for one month deposits to 22.5 percent from 20.5 percent.
These changes would also take effect June 12.
